title.narrative: Provision of Critical Support to Afghan Refugees and Migrants in Pakistan

description.narrative: Pakistan presently hosts up to 1.4 million Afghan Citizenship Card holders and undocumented Afghan migrants. The intensified armed conflict in Afghanistan in 2021 and the resulting upheaval in August 2021 have caused increased humanitarian and stabilization needs and a significant deterioration of the protection environment for civilians in the country. The most recent political transition and the increase of violence across Afghanistan have clear implications for the broader region, including a recent increase in the number of Afghan nationals crossing into Pakistan. With this trend projected to continue in the short to medium term, improved processes for safe and orderly border management are needed, in addition to efforts to address the ongoing and burgeoning needs in the communities in Pakistan hosting high levels of Afghan migrants, refugees and new arrivals. This project aims to propose a set of activities to address key protection concerns and increase livelihood opportunities for vulnerable Afghan migrants and host community members, improve border management between Afghanistan and Pakistan, and expand the evidence-based on mobility trends between both countries.
